Depending on the location of the tumor, the surgeon may remove a small part of the lung, a lobe of the lung, or the entire lung. - Conventional chemotherapy uses anti-cancer drugs to kill cancer cells throughout the body. Doctors use chemotherapy to control cancer growth and relieve symptoms. Anti-cancer drugs are given by injection; through a catheter, a long thin tube temporarily placed in a large vein; or in pill form. Convent
